info.headline: Severe Thunderstorm Warning issued March 03 at 4:41PM EST until March 03 at 5:45PM EST by NWS Greenville-Spartanburg
info.description: The National Weather Service in Greenville-Spartanburg has issued a * Severe Thunderstorm Warning for... Madison County in western North Carolina... Mitchell County in western North Carolina... Buncombe County in western North Carolina... Yancey County in western North Carolina... * Until 545 PM EST. * At 440 PM EST, a severe thunderstorm was located 12 miles southwest of Marshall, or 7 miles west of Leicester, moving northeast at 70 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Expect damage to trees and power lines. * Locations impacted include... Downtown Asheville, Spruce Pine, Burnsville, Marshall, East Asheville, West Asheville, North Asheville, Woodfin, Weaverville and Mars Hill. HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...<.75 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: A Tornado Watch remains in effect until 800 PM EST for western North Carolina. For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building. Please report damaging winds, hail, or flooding to the National Weather Service by calling toll free, 1, 800, 2 6 7, 8 1 0 1, or by posting on our Facebook page, or Tweet it using hashtag nwsgsp. Your message should describe the event and the specific location where it occurred.
